editableContainer.name: editableContainer
editableContainer.description:
Attaches stand-alone container with editable-form to HTML element. Element is used only for positioning, value is not stored anywhere.
This method applied internally in $().editable(). You should subscribe on it's events (save / cancel) to get profit of it.
Final realization can be different: bootstrap-popover, jqueryui-tooltip, poshytip, inline-div. It depends on which js file you include.
Applied as jQuery method.

editableform.name: editableform
editableform.description:
Form with single input element, two buttons and two states: normal/loading.
Applied as jQuery method to DIV tag (not to form tag!). This is because form can be in loading state when spinner shown.
Editableform is linked with one of input types, e.g. 'text', 'select' etc.

editable.name: editable
editable.description: Makes editable any HTML element on the page. Applied as jQuery method.

combodate.name: combodate
combodate.description:
Combodate input - dropdown date and time picker.    
Based on [combodate](http://vitalets.github.com/combodate) plugin (included). To use it you should manually include [momentjs](http://momentjs.com).

    <script src="js/moment.min.js"></script>
   
Allows to input:

* only date
* only time 
* both date and time  

Please note, that format is taken from momentjs and **not compatible** with bootstrap-datepicker / jquery UI datepicker.  
Internally value stored as `momentjs` object.

date.name: date
date.description:
Bootstrap-datepicker.  
Description and examples: https://github.com/eternicode/bootstrap-datepicker.  
For **i18n** you should include js file from here: https://github.com/eternicode/bootstrap-datepicker/tree/master/js/locales
and set `language` option.  
Since 1.4.0 date has different appearance in **popup** and **inline** modes.
example: 15/05/1984

datefield.name: datefield
datefield.description:
Bootstrap datefield input - modification for inline mode.
Shows normal <input type="text"> and binds popup datepicker.  
Automatically shown in inline mode.

datetime.name: datetime
datetime.description:
Bootstrap-datetimepicker.  
Based on [smalot bootstrap-datetimepicker plugin](https://github.com/smalot/bootstrap-datetimepicker). 
Before usage you should manually include dependent js and css:

    <link href="css/datetimepicker.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"></link> 
    <script src="js/bootstrap-datetimepicker.js"></script>

For **i18n** you should include js file from here: https://github.com/smalot/bootstrap-datetimepicker/tree/master/js/locales
and set `language` option.
example: 15/03/2013 12:45

datetimefield.name: datetimefield
datetimefield.description:
Bootstrap datetimefield input - datetime input for inline mode.
Shows normal <input type="text"> and binds popup datetimepicker.  
Automatically shown in inline mode.

dateui.name: dateui
dateui.description: jQuery UI Datepicker. Description and examples: http://jqueryui.com/datepicker. This input is also accessible as **date** type. Do not use it together with __bootstrap-datepicker__ as both apply $().datepicker() method. For **i18n** you should include js file from here: https://github.com/jquery/jquery-ui/tree/master/ui/i18n.
example: 15/05/1984

dateuifield.name: dateuifield
dateuifield.description:
jQuery UI datefield input - modification for inline mode.
Shows normal <input type="text"> and binds popup datepicker.  
Automatically shown in inline mode.

select2.name: select2
select2.description: Select2 input. Based on amazing work of Igor Vaynberg https://github.com/ivaynberg/select2. Please see [original select2 docs](http://ivaynberg.github.com/select2) for detailed description and options. Compatible **select2 version is 3.4.1**! You should manually download and include select2 distributive: To make it **bootstrap-styled** you can use css from [here](https://github.com/t0m/select2-bootstrap-css): **Note:** currently `autotext` feature does not work for select2 with `ajax` remote source. You need initially put both `data-value` and element's text youself: Text1

abstractinput.name: abstractinput
abstractinput.description:
AbstractInput - base class for all editable inputs.
It defines interface to be implemented by any input type.
To create your own input you can inherit from this class.

checklist.name: checklist
checklist.description:
List of checkboxes. 
Internally value stored as javascript array of values.

html5types.name: html5types
html5types.description:
HTML5 input types.
Following types are supported:

* password
* email
* url
* tel
* number
* range
* time

Learn more about html5 inputs:  
http://www.w3.org/wiki/HTML5_form_additions  
To check browser compatibility please see:  
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/HTML/Element/Input
example: admin@example.com

list.name: list
list.description: List - abstract class for inputs that have source option loaded from js array or via ajax

select.name: select

text.name: text
example: awesome

textarea.name: textarea
example: awesome comment!

typeahead.name: typeahead
typeahead.description:
Typeahead input (bootstrap only). Based on Twitter Bootstrap [typeahead](http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/javascript.html#typeahead).  
Depending on `source` format typeahead operates in two modes:

* **strings**:  
  When `source` defined as array of strings, e.g. `['text1', 'text2', 'text3' ...]`.  
  User can submit one of these strings or any text entered in input (even if it is not matching source).
  
* **objects**:  
  When `source` defined as array of objects, e.g. `[{value: 1, text: "text1"}, {value: 2, text: "text2"}, ...]`.  
  User can submit only values that are in source (otherwise `null` is submitted). This is more like *dropdown* behavior.

wysihtml5.name: wysihtml5
wysihtml5.description:
Bootstrap wysihtml5 editor. Based on [bootstrap-wysihtml5](https://github.com/jhollingworth/bootstrap-wysihtml5).  
You should include **manually** distributives of `wysihtml5` and `bootstrap-wysihtml5`:

    <link href="js/inputs-ext/wysihtml5/bootstrap-wysihtml5-0.0.2/bootstrap-wysihtml5-0.0.2.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"></link>  
    <script src="js/inputs-ext/wysihtml5/bootstrap-wysihtml5-0.0.2/wysihtml5-0.3.0.min.js"></script>  
    <script src="js/inputs-ext/wysihtml5/bootstrap-wysihtml5-0.0.2/bootstrap-wysihtml5-0.0.2.min.js"></script>
    
And also include `wysihtml5.js` from `inputs-ext` directory of x-editable:
      
    <script src="js/inputs-ext/wysihtml5/wysihtml5.js"></script>  

**Note:** It's better to use fresh bootstrap-wysihtml5 from it's [master branch](https://github.com/jhollingworth/bootstrap-wysihtml5/tree/master/src) as there is update for correct image insertion.
example:
awesome

comment!

classitems.description:
Fired when container is shown and form is rendered (for select will wait for loading dropdown options).  
**Note:** Bootstrap popover has own `shown` event that now cannot be separated from x-editable's one.
The workaround is to check `arguments.length` that is always `2` for x-editable.
classitems.name: shown

classitems.description: Shows container with form
classitems.name: show()

params.name: closeAll
params.description: Whether to close all other editable containers when showing this one. Default true.

classitems.description: Hides container with form
classitems.name: hide()

classitems.description:
Fired when container was hidden. It occurs on both save or cancel.  
**Note:** Bootstrap popover has own `hidden` event that now cannot be separated from x-editable's one.
The workaround is to check `arguments.length` that is always `2` for x-editable.
classitems.name: hidden

classitems.description: Toggles container visibility (show / hide)
classitems.name: toggle()

params.name: closeAll
params.description: Whether to close all other editable containers when showing this one. Default true.

classitems.description: Fired when new value was submitted. You can use $(this).data('editableContainer') inside handler to access to editableContainer instance
classitems.name: save

classitems.description: Sets new option
classitems.name: option(key, value)

classitems.description: Destroys the container instance
classitems.name: destroy()

classitems.description: Activates input of visible container (e.g. set focus)
classitems.name: activate()

classitems.description: jQuery method to initialize editableContainer.
classitems.name: $().editableContainer(options)

classitems.description: Initial value of form input
classitems.name: value

classitems.description: Placement of container relative to element. Can be top|right|bottom|left. Not used for inline container.
classitems.name: placement

classitems.description: Whether to hide container on save/cancel.
classitems.name: autohide

classitems.description: Action when user clicks outside the container. Can be cancel|submit|ignore. Setting ignore allows to have several containers open.
classitems.name: onblur

classitems.description: Animation speed (inline mode only)
classitems.name: anim

classitems.description: Mode of editable, can be `popup` or `inline`
classitems.name: mode

classitems.description:
Editable Inline 
---------------------

Editable Popover 
---------------------
requires bootstrap-popover.js
move popover to new position. This function mainly copied from bootstrap-popover.

Editable Poshytip 
---------------------
requires jquery.poshytip.js

Poshytip fix: disable incorrect table display
see https://github.com/vadikom/poshytip/issues/7

Editable jQuery UI Tooltip 
---------------------
requires jquery ui 1.9.x
EditableForm utilites
classic JS inheritance function

set caret position in input
see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/499126/jquery-set-cursor-position-in-text-area

function to parse JSON in *single* quotes. (jquery automatically parse only double quotes)
That allows such code as: <a data-source="{'a': 'b', 'c': 'd'}">
safe = true --> means no exception will be thrown
for details see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7410348/how-to-set-json-format-to-html5-data-attributes-in-the-jquery
slice object by specified keys
method to escape html.
Renders editableform
classitems.name: render

classitems.description: Fired when rendering starts
classitems.name: rendering

classitems.description: Fired when form is rendered
classitems.name: rendered

classitems.description: Fired when form was cancelled by user
classitems.name: cancel

classitems.description: Fired when form is shown
classitems.name: show

classitems.description: Fired when value not changed but form is submitted. Requires savenochange = false.
classitems.name: nochange

classitems.description: Fired when form is submitted
classitems.name: save

classitems.description: Type of input. Can be text|textarea|select|date|checklist
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: Url for submit, e.g. '/post' If function - it will be called instead of ajax. Function should return deferred object to run fail/done callbacks.
classitems.name: url

classitems.description: Additional params for submit. If defined as object - it is **appended** to original ajax data (pk, name and value). If defined as function - returned object **overwrites** original ajax data.
classitems.name: params

classitems.description: Name of field. Will be submitted on server. Can be taken from id attribute
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: Primary key of editable object (e.g. record id in database). For composite keys use object, e.g. {id: 1, lang: 'en'}. Can be calculated dynamically via function.
classitems.name: pk

classitems.description:
Initial value. If not defined - will be taken from element's content.
For __select__ type should be defined (as it is ID of shown text).
classitems.name: value

classitems.description: Value that will be displayed in input if original field value is empty (`null|undefined|''`).
classitems.name: defaultValue

classitems.description:
Strategy for sending data on server. Can be `auto|always|never`.
When 'auto' data will be sent on server **only if pk and url defined**, otherwise new value will be stored locally.
classitems.name: send

classitems.description: Function for client-side validation. If returns string - means validation not passed and string showed as error.
classitems.name: validate

classitems.description: Success callback. Called when value successfully sent on server and **response status = 200**. Usefull to work with json response. For example, if your backend response can be {success: true} or {success: false, msg: "server error"} you can check it inside this callback. If it returns **string** - means error occured and string is shown as error message. If it returns **object like** {newValue: <something>} - it overwrites value, submitted by user. Otherwise newValue simply rendered into element.
classitems.name: success

classitems.description:
Error callback. Called when request failed (response status != 200).  
Usefull when you want to parse error response and display a custom message.
Must return **string** - the message to be displayed in the error block.
classitems.name: error

classitems.description:
Additional options for submit ajax request.
List of values: http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax
classitems.name: ajaxOptions

classitems.description:
Where to show buttons: left(true)|bottom|false  
Form without buttons is auto-submitted.
classitems.name: showbuttons

classitems.description: Scope for callback methods (success, validate). If null means editableform instance itself.
classitems.name: scope

classitems.description: Whether to save or cancel value when it was not changed but form was submitted
classitems.name: savenochange

classitems.description:
Fired when element was initialized by `$().editable()` method. 
Please note that you should setup `init` handler **before** applying `editable`.
classitems.name: init

params.name: editable
params.description: editable instance (as here it cannot accessed via data('editable'))

classitems.description: Enables editable
classitems.name: enable()

classitems.description: Disables editable
classitems.name: disable()

classitems.description: Toggles enabled / disabled state of editable element
classitems.name: toggleDisabled()

classitems.description: Sets new option
classitems.name: option(key, value)

params.name: key
params.description: option name or object with several options

example: $('.editable').editable('option', 'pk', 2);

classitems.description: Shows container with form
classitems.name: show()

params.name: closeAll
params.description: Whether to close all other editable containers when showing this one. Default true.

params.name: closeAll
params.description: Whether to close all other editable containers when showing this one. Default true.

classitems.description: Fired when new value was submitted. You can use $(this).data('editable') to access to editable instance
classitems.name: save

classitems.description: Sets new value of editable
classitems.name: setValue(value, convertStr)

params.name: convertStr
params.description: whether to convert value from string to internal format

classitems.description: Activates input of visible container (e.g. set focus)
classitems.name: activate()

classitems.description: Removes editable feature from element
classitems.name: destroy()

classitems.description: jQuery method to initialize editable element.
classitems.name: $().editable(options)

classitems.description: Runs client-side validation for all matched editables
classitems.name: validate()

classitems.description:
Returns current values of editable elements.   
Note that it returns an **object** with name-value pairs, not a value itself. It allows to get data from several elements.    
If value of some editable is `null` or `undefined` it is excluded from result object.
When param `isSingle` is set to **true** - it is supposed you have single element and will return value of editable instead of object.
classitems.name: getValue()

params.name: isSingle
params.description: whether to return just value of single element

return.description: object of element names and values

classitems.description: This method collects values from several editable elements and submit them all to server. Internally it runs client-side validation for all fields and submits only in case of success. See creating new records for details.
classitems.name: submit(options)

classitems.description: Type of input. Can be text|textarea|select|date|checklist and more
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: Sets disabled state of editable
classitems.name: disabled

classitems.description: How to toggle editable. Can be click|dblclick|mouseenter|manual. When set to manual you should manually call show/hide methods of editable. **Note**: if you call show or toggle inside **click** handler of some DOM element, you need to apply e.stopPropagation() because containers are being closed on any click on document.
classitems.name: toggle

classitems.description: Text shown when element is empty.
classitems.name: emptytext

classitems.description: Allows to automatically set element's text based on it's value. Can be auto|always|never. Useful for select and date. For example, if dropdown list is {1: 'a', 2: 'b'} and element's value set to 1, it's html will be automatically set to 'a'. auto - text will be automatically set only if element is empty. always|never - always(never) try to set element's text.
classitems.name: autotext

classitems.description:
Initial value of input. If not set, taken from element's text.  
Note, that if element's text is empty - text is automatically generated from value and can be customized (see `autotext` option).  
For example, to display currency sign:
classitems.name: value

classitems.description:
Callback to perform custom displaying of value in element's text.  
If `null`, default input's display used.  
If `false`, no displaying methods will be called, element's text will never change.  
Runs under element's scope.  
_**Parameters:**_  

* `value` current value to be displayed
* `response` server response (if display called after ajax submit), since 1.4.0
 
For _inputs with source_ (select, checklist) parameters are different:  
  
* `value` current value to be displayed
* `sourceData` array of items for current input (e.g. dropdown items) 
* `response` server response (if display called after ajax submit), since 1.4.0
          
To get currently selected items use `$.fn.editableutils.itemsByValue(value, sourceData)`.
classitems.name: display

classitems.description: Css class applied when editable text is empty.
classitems.name: emptyclass

classitems.description:
Css class applied when value was stored but not sent to server (`pk` is empty or `send = 'never'`).  
You may set it to `null` if you work with editables locally and submit them together.
classitems.name: unsavedclass

classitems.description:
If selector is provided, editable will be delegated to the specified targets.  
Usefull for dynamically generated DOM elements.  
**Please note**, that delegated targets can't be initialized with `emptytext` and `autotext` options, 
as they actually become editable only after first click.  
You should manually set class `editable-click` to these elements.  
Also, if element originally empty you should add class `editable-empty`, set `data-value=""` and write emptytext into element:
classitems.name: selector
example: Empty Operator

classitems.description: Color used to highlight element after update. Implemented via CSS3 transition, works in modern browsers.
classitems.name: highlight

classitems.description:
Format used for sending value to server. Also applied when converting date from data-value attribute.
See list of tokens in [momentjs docs](http://momentjs.com/docs/#/parsing/string-format)
classitems.name: format

classitems.description:
Format used for displaying date. Also applied when converting date from element's text on init.   
If not specified equals to `format`.

Format used for sending value to server. Also applied when converting date from data-value attribute.

classitems.name: datepicker

classitems.description: Placeholder attribute of select
classitems.name: placeholder

classitems.description:
Source data for select. It will be assigned to select2 `data` property and kept here just for convenience.
Please note, that format is different from simple `select` input: use 'id' instead of 'value'.
E.g. `[{id: 1, text: "text1"}, {id: 2, text: "text2"}, ...]`.
classitems.name: source

classitems.description: Separator used to display tags.
classitems.name: viewseparator

classitems.name: init()

Renders input from tpl. Can return jQuery deferred object.
Can be overwritten in child objects

classitems.description: Sets element's html by value.
classitems.name: value2html(value, element)

classitems.description: Converts element's html to value
classitems.name: html2value(html)

classitems.description: Converts value to string (for internal compare). For submitting to server used value2submit().
classitems.name: value2str(value)

classitems.description: Converts string received from server into value. Usually from `data-value` attribute.
classitems.name: str2value(str)

classitems.description: Converts value for submitting to server. Result can be string or object.
classitems.name: value2submit(value)

classitems.description: Sets value of input.
classitems.name: value2input(value)

classitems.description: Returns value of input. Value can be object (e.g. datepicker)

classitems.description: Activates input. For text it sets focus.

classitems.description: Creates input.
classitems.name: clear()

classitems.description: method to escape html.
attach handler to automatically submit form when value changed (useful when buttons not shown)
Additional actions when destroying element
HTML template of input. Normally you should not change it.
classitems.name: tpl

classitems.description: CSS class automatically applied to input
classitems.name: inputclass

classitems.description: Separator of values when reading from `data-value` attribute
classitems.name: separator

classitems.description: convert data to array suitable for sourceData, e.g. [{value: 1, text: 'abc'}, {...}]

Source data for list.  
If **array** - it should be in format: `[{value: 1, text: "text1"}, {value: 2, text: "text2"}, ...]`  
For compability, object format is also supported: `{"1": "text1", "2": "text2" ...}` but it does not guarantee elements order.

If **string** - considered ajax url to load items. In that case results will be cached for fields with the same source and name. See also `sourceCache` option.
  
If **function**, it should return data in format above (since 1.4.0).

Since 1.4.1 key `children` supported to render OPTGROUP (for **select** input only).  
`[{text: "group1", children: [{value: 1, text: "text1"}, {value: 2, text: "text2"}]}, ...]`
classitems.name: source

classitems.description: Data automatically prepended to the beginning of dropdown list.
classitems.name: prepend

classitems.description: Error message when list cannot be loaded (e.g. ajax error)
classitems.name: sourceError

classitems.description: if true and source is **string url** - results will be cached for fields with the same source. Usefull for editable column in grid to prevent extra requests.
classitems.name: sourceCache

classitems.description: Placeholder attribute of input. Shown when input is empty.
classitems.name: placeholder

classitems.description: Whether to show `clear` button
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description: Placeholder attribute of input. Shown when input is empty.
classitems.name: placeholder

classitems.description: Number of rows in textarea

classitems.name: typeahead

classitems.description: Whether to show `clear` button
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description: Placeholder attribute of input. Shown when input is empty.
classitems.name: placeholder

Wysihtml5 default options.  
See https://github.com/jhollingworth/bootstrap-wysihtml5#options
classitems.name: wysihtml5
